# MLClassifierMetrics

**Structure**

Metrics you use to evaluate a classifier’s performance.

## Declaration

```swift
struct MLClassifierMetrics
```

## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifierMetrics] to evaluate your model’s ability to distinguish between different categories when it’s classifying data.

You can determine the model’s accuracy using the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifierMetrics/classificationError] metric. For information about how your model is mislabeling or missing a certain category, use the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifierMetrics/precisionRecall] metric. To determine specific cases where your model is mistaking one label for another, use the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifierMetrics/confusion] property.

Accuracy can be a misleading metric if you use unbalanced data, which means the number of examples for some categories are much larger than others. Instead, use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifierMetrics/precisionRecall] or [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifierMetrics/confusion].



## Understanding the model

- **classificationError**: The fraction of incorrectly labeled examples.
- **precisionRecall**: A data table listing the precision and recall percentages for each class.
- **confusion**: A table comparing the actual and predicted labels for each classification category.
- **confusionDataFrame**: A data frame comparing the actual and predicted labels for each class.
- **precisionRecallDataFrame**: A data frame listing the precision and recall percentages for each class.

## Handling errors

- **isValid**: A Boolean value indicating whether the classifier model was able to calculate metrics.
- **error**: The underlying error present when the metrics are invalid.

## Creating metrics

- **init(classificationError:confusion:precisionRecall:)**: Creates empty classifier metrics.

## Describing metrics

- **description**: A text representation of the classifier metrics.
- **debugDescription**: A text representation of the classifier metrics that’s suitable for output during debugging.
- **playgroundDescription**: A description of the classifier metrics shown in a playground.

## Default Implementations

- **CustomDebugStringConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**

## Model accuracy

- **Improving Your Model’s Accuracy**: Use metrics to tune the performance of your machine learning model.
- **MLRegressorMetrics**: Metrics you use to evaluate a regressor’s performance.
- **MLWordTaggerMetrics**: Metrics you use to evaluate a word tagger’s performance.
- **MLRecommenderMetrics**: Metrics you use to evaluate a recommender’s performance.
- **MLObjectDetectorMetrics**: Metrics you use to evaluate an object detector’s performance.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
